module.name: Forms
module.short: Contains definitions and descriptions for constructing the Forms which are the basis of the Lazarus Graphical User Interface

element.name: TProcedure

element.name: TPosition
element.short: Represents the Position and Size of a Form on Screen.

descr.p: poDesigned - The Form appears exactly as it is positioned and sized in the Form Designer
poDefault - The window manager decides how the form is to appear, in a default position and size
poDefaultPosOnly - keeps the Designed size, but position determined by windowmanager
poDefaultSizeOnly - keeps the Designed position, but size determined by windowmanager
poScreenCenter - Centers the form on screen
poDeskTopCenter - Centers the form on desktop
poMainFormCenter - Centers the Form on the Main Form
poOwnerFormCenter - Centers the Form on Owner form

element.name: TPosition.poDesigned
element.short: The Form appears exactly as it is positioned and sized in the Form Designer.

element.name: TPosition.poDefault
element.short: The window manager decides how the form is to appear, in a default position and size.

element.short: Keeps the designed form size, but position determined by windowmanager.

element.name: TPosition.poDefaultSizeOnly
element.short: Keeps the designed form position, but size determined by windowmanager.

element.name: TPosition.poScreenCenter
element.short: Centers the form on screen.

element.name: TPosition.poDesktopCenter
element.short: Centers the form on the desktop (not recommended, use poScreenCenter).

element.name: TPosition.poMainFormCenter
element.short: Centers the form on the Main Form.

element.name: TPosition.poOwnerFormCenter
element.short: Centers the form on its Owner form.

element.name: TWindowState
element.short: Represents the actual State of the window on the screen.

descr.p: The actual meaning of each value depends on the platform:
Windows and Mac OS X - These operating systems support all values.
X11 - The window state is a hint sent to the Window Manager, so more primitive Window Managers might ignore this hints.

Windows CE - In Windows CE platforms where Application.ApplicationType = atKeyPadDevice or atPDA (like in Windows Phone, PocketPC and Windows Mobile), wsMinimized and wsNormal are understood as wsMaximized, which is the normal state for windows in this platform. An exception are windows with BorderStyle=bsDialog or bsNone, which are allowed to have a custom position and size. For more information please read http://wiki.lazarus.freepascal.org/Windows_CE_Development_Notes#Positioning_and_size_of_Dialogs_and_Forms
Android - In this platform windows are always fullscreen.
The valid values for this enumerated type are:
wsNormal - The window appears normal
wsMinimized - The window is minimized and is not shown in the screen, but only in the taskbar
wsMaximized - The window appears maximized
wsFullScreen - The window appears in full screen mode, as much as allowed by the platform.

element.name: TWindowState.wsNormal
element.short: Neither maximized nor minimized.

element.name: TWindowState.wsMinimized
element.short: Minimized to the taskbar.

element.name: TWindowState.wsMaximized
element.short: Maximized [to the full monitor?]

element.name: TControlScrollBar
element.short: Type of a scrollbar in a .

descr.p: Scrollable controls supply their own integrated scrollbars, one for horizontal and one for vertical scrolling. This class allows access to (one of) these integrated scrollbars.
A scrollable control has both a physical (visible) client size, and a logical (virtual) client size.
The Range property reflects the total virtual client size, in pixels.
The Page property corresponds to physical (visible) client size, in pixels, excluding[?] the scrollbars. It also determines the size of the slider, relative to the total Range.
The Position property reflects the virtual origin of the visible client area, equivalent to the top coordinate of the slider. The Position can be changed by the user or by code.
Scrollbars usually appear only when Range is higher than Page, i.e. when not the entire content can be shown at the same time. See the ScrollBar property of the scrolling control for details.

element.short: If Source is a TControlScrollBar, copies properties to itself, else performs inherited Assign.
element.descr: Assigns the contents of the source object to the current object; in particular finds the increment, position, range and whether smooth scrolling is to be feature and whether the scroll bar is visible

element.short: Determines the current widget state.

element.short: True if scrollbar is visible.

element.short: The scroll Position, zero if not Visible.

element.short: The scroll Position, zero if not Visible.

element.name: TControlScrollBar.GetOtherScrollBar
element.short: Get the ScrollBar of the opposite direction (horz/vert).

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ClientSize
element.short: The currently remaining extent of the Parent Control, depending on ScrollBar visibility.
element.descr: return for vertical scrollbar the clientwidth

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ClientSize.Result
element.short: for vertical scrollbar the clientwidth

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ClientSizeWithBar
element.short: The remaining extent of the Parent Control, when the ScrollBar is visible.
element.descr: return for vertical scrollbar the clientwidth with the bar, even if Visible=false

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ClientSizeWithBar.Result
element.short: for vertical scrollbar the clientwidth with the bar, even if Visible=false

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ClientSizeWithoutBar
element.short: The remaining extent of the Parent Control, when the ScrollBar is not visible.
element.descr: return for vertical scrollbar the clientwidth without the bar, even if Visible=true

element.name: TControlScrollBar.ClientSizeWithoutBar.Result
element.short: for vertical scrollbar the clientwidth without the bar, even if Visible=true

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Increment
element.short: The small Position increment, applicable to the scrollbar arrows.
element.descr:
The amount by which the Position moves if the triangle at either end of the bar is selected.
Default is 8 (pixels).

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Kind
element.short: The orientation: horizontal or vertical.

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Page
element.short: The slider size, Position increment applicable to the scrollbar area beneath the slider.
element.descr:
The amount by which the scroll indicator moves if the cursor selects the scroll bar above, below or on either side of the scroll indicator.
Default is 80 (pixels).

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Position
element.short: Position of the slider, 0..Range-Page.
element.descr: The Position reflects the top coordinate of the slider, which is Range-Page when the slider is at the bottom of the bar.

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Smooth
element.short: Enables smooth scrolling, with automatic adjustment of Increment and Page.
element.descr: Smooth scrolling uses an Increment of 10% and a Page size of 90% of the visible client area[?]

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Range
element.short: The virtual size of the Parent Control.

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Size
element.short: The adjustable size of the scroll bar.
element.descr: The length of the bar is the Width (or Height) of the Parent Control, the Size is the other (free) coordinate.

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Tracking
element.short: Gives feedback while the slider is dragged.
element.descr: When it takes an significant amount of time, to repaint the parent control at a new position, Tracking should be False to prevent flicker; then the control is updated only when the slider is released.

element.name: TControlScrollBar.Visible
element.short: Definitely hides the scrollbar when False (default True).

descr.p: The scrollbar widget is visible only if (Visible=True) and (Range>Page).
Set Visible to False to disallow the user to scroll the content, while the content still can be scrolled by code.
Use IsScrollBarVisible to get the current visible state of the widget.

element.name: TScrollingWinControl

element.descr: This class introduces a logical (virtual) client area, part of which is visible in the physical (visible) client area. ScrollBars allow the user to scroll through the logical client area.

element.name: TDefaultMonitor
element.short: The preferred monitor for showing a form.

descr.p: When a form is not assigned to a specific monitor, assume the following display context:

ul.li: dmMainForm - on the same monitor as the main form. If there is no main form then use dmPrimary behavior.
dmActiveForm - on the same monitor as the currently active form. If there is no active form use dmMainForm behavior.

element.name: TDefaultMonitor.dmDesktop
element.short: Place the form on the full desktop.

element.name: TDefaultMonitor.dmPrimary
element.short: Place the form on the primary monitor.

element.name: TDefaultMonitor.dmMainForm
element.short: Place the form on the same monitor as the main form. If there is no such form then use the primary monitor.

element.name: TDefaultMonitor.dmActiveForm
element.short: Place the form on the same monitor as the currently active form. If there is no such form then use the primary monitor.

element.short: Here: ignored [purpose?]

element.name: TCustomForm.BigIconHandle
element.short: The Handle of the big form icon.

element.name: TCustomForm.Close
element.short: Close the form.

descr.p: Close does not necessarily destroy the form. Modal forms only are hidden.
When the MainForm is closed, the application terminates.
An OnCloseQuery handler can deny to close the form.

element.name: TCustomForm.CloseQuery
element.short: Asks the OnCloseQuery handler whether the form can close.

element.name: TCustomForm.DefocusControl
element.short: Updates ActiveControl if it is to be defocused.

element.name: TCustomForm.DefocusControl.Control
element.short: The control that looses the focus.

element.name: TCustomForm.DefocusControl.Removing
element.short: True when the control is removed.

element.name: TCustomForm.EnsureVisible
element.short: Ensure that this form is fully visible, optionally brings it in front of all forms.

element.name: TCustomForm.EnsureVisible.AMoveToTop
element.short: Bring the form to front if True.

element.name: TCustomForm.FocusControl
element.short: Focus the control. If needed [when? always?] bring form to front.
element.errors: If the control or one of its parents is not visible or disabled an exception will be raised (in SetFocus).

element.name: TCustomForm.FocusControl.WinControl
element.short: The control receiving the focus.

element.name: TCustomForm.GetFormImage
element.short: Makes a Bitmap image from the Form.

element.name: TCustomForm.GetRolesForControl
element.short: The role(s) of the control in a modal form (default or cancel button).

element.name: TCustomForm.IntfDropFiles
element.short: Invokes the OnDropFiles handler of the form. This function is called by the interface.
element.descr: The drop files event will be invoked when the user drops one or multiple dragged files on one of application's forms. First this event should be fired for target form (or main form if drop target is unknown), then for the application.

element.name: TCustomForm.IntfHelp
element.short: Show help for control or menu item. This function is called by the interface.

element.name: TCustomForm.IsShortcut
element.short: Asks all applicable components to interpret an keystroke as an shortcut. True, the specified Key and Message are active as a shortcut

element.name: TCustomForm.IsShortcut.Result
element.short: True when the specified Key was handled as a shortcut.

element.name: TCustomForm.MakeFullyVisible
element.short: Extends or shrinks the form to a monitor.

element.name: TCustomForm.MakeFullyVisible.AMonitor
element.short: The monitor to use, Nil means the designed monitor.

element.name: TCustomForm.MakeFullyVisible.UseWorkarea
element.short: If True then extend to the WorkArea of the monitor, else clip the form to the monitor bounds.

element.name: TCustomForm.AutoSizeDelayedHandle
element.short: Returns true if AutoSize should be skipped / delayed because of a missing handle.
element.descr: [propagate back into TControl?]

element.name: TCustomForm.Release
element.short: Marks the form for destruction.

element.name: TCustomForm.CanFocus
element.short: True when the form can receive the focus.

element.name: TCustomForm.SetFocusedControl
element.short: Handles focus switch to a control (enter/exit messages).

element.name: TCustomForm.SetFocusedControl.Result
element.short: False when no switching allowed[?]

element.name: TCustomForm.SetFocusedControl.Control
element.short: The control that received the focus[?]

element.name: TCustomForm.SetRestoredBounds
element.short: Sets the bounds defining the restored control.
element.descr: Temporarily goes to normal (restored) window state, if required.

element.name: TCustomForm.ShowModal
element.short: Show this form as a modal Dialog.
element.descr: The call doesn't return until the form is closed. The application switches to modal state until then.
element.errors: EInvalidOperation if the form cannot be shown modally.

element.name: TCustomForm.ShowModal.Result
element.short: The modal result of the dialog.

element.name: TCustomForm.ShowOnTop
element.short: Shows this form in front of all other forms.

element.name: TCustomForm.SmallIconHandle
element.short: Returns (eventually creates) the Handle of the small Form or Application Icon.

element.name: TCustomForm.WantChildKey.Result
element.short: Here: always False.

element.name: TCustomForm.AddHandlerFirstShow
element.short: Adds an handler for the first Show of the form.

element.name: TCustomForm.RemoveHandlerFirstShow
element.short: Removes an handler for the first Show of the form.

element.name: TCustomForm.AddHandlerClose
element.short: Adds an handler for form Close.

element.name: TCustomForm.RemoveHandlerClose
element.short: Removes an handler for form Close.

element.name: TCustomForm.AddHandlerCreate
element.short: Adds an handler for form Create.

element.name: TCustomForm.RemoveHandlerCreate
element.short: Removes an handler for form Create.

element.name: TCustomForm.ActiveMDIChild
element.short: Returns the currently active MDI child form.
element.descr: Valid result is returned only when FormStyle = fsMDIForm or fsMDIChild, otherwise Result is nil.

element.name: TCustomForm.ActiveMDIChild.Result
element.short: Nil if the form is neither an MDI host nor child.

element.name: TCustomForm.GetMDIChildren.Result
element.short: Nil if caller isn't an mdi type or handle isn't allocated.

element.name: TCustomForm.MDIChildCount.Result
element.short: -1 if caller isn't an MDI form or handle is not allocated.

element.name: TCustomForm.Active
element.short: Is true when the form has the focus.
element.descr: Use active to check if the form has the focus

element.name: TCustomForm.ActiveControl
element.short: Specifies the active control on the form.
element.descr: Use this to get or set the active control on this form.

element.name: TCustomForm.ActiveDefaultControl
element.short: Specifies the Default control on the Form.
element.descr: The Default control reacts on the Enter key pressed.

element.name: TCustomForm.AllowDropFiles
element.short: Specifies whether files can be dropped onto this form.
element.descr: Set AllowDropFiles event to True to allow dropping files on this form. It is set to False by default.

element.name: TCustomForm.AlphaBlend
element.short: Allows for a translucent form [somewhat transparent?].

element.name: TCustomForm.AlphaBlendValue
element.short: How translucent the form is (0=transparent, 255=opaque).

element.name: TCustomForm.BorderIcons
element.short: Specifies which icons appear in the title bar of the form.
element.descr: The icons can represent a system menu, minimize/restore/maximize and close buttons, and an What's this button.

element.name: TCustomForm.BorderStyle
element.short: The border style affects the title bar, border and resize behaviour of the form.

descr.p: Use borderstyle to get or set the appearance of the form's border.
By default it is a sizeable window, but it could, for example, be a dialog form or a tool window, or could be non-sizeable

This property is slightly different (has a different base type) from the TCustomControl.BorderStyle When the form is put into another control the window borders depend on the widgetset. There are no borders under gtk.

element.name: TCustomForm.CancelControl
element.short: The control associated with the Cancel action.

descr.p: Determines the control associated with the Cancel action (exit from the modal form without changing anything).
This is usually a button with the caption 'Cancel', but might be an 'Exit' button or anything else the application programmer decides.
This control is selected either by explicitly clicking with the mouse, or by hitting the 'Esc' key.

element.name: TCustomForm.Caption
element.short: The text appearing in the title bar.

element.name: TCustomForm.ClientHandle
element.short: The Handle of the MDIForm client (container for mdi children).

element.name: TCustomForm.Color
element.descr: The form's background color.

element.name: TCustomForm.DefaultControl
element.short: The control associated with the default action for this form.
element.descr: This is typically a button such as 'Accept' which is highlighted in some way on-screen to indicate that this is the default action, and is selected either by hitting 'Return' or 'Enter' or by selecting that control with the mouse.

element.name: TCustomForm.DefaultMonitor
element.short: The monitor type on which the form shall appear.

element.name: TCustomForm.Designer
element.short: The designer object when the form is in design state.

element.name: TCustomForm.FormState
element.short: Various state flags.

element.name: TCustomForm.FormStyle
element.short: Determines the Style of the form (MDI, splash...).

element.name: TCustomForm.HelpFile
element.short: The name of the help file for this form.

element.name: TCustomForm.Icon
element.short: The Icon associated with this Form (in minimized state).

element.name: TCustomForm.KeyPreview
element.short: Allows the form to intercept keystrokes in child controls.

element.name: TCustomForm.MDIChildren
element.short: Indexed access to MDI child forms, when this is an MDI form.

element.name: TCustomForm.Menu
element.short: The main menu for this form.
element.descr: Drop a TMainMenu on the form to store it here and to show it on the form.

element.name: TCustomForm.ModalResult
element.short: Specifies the return value of a modal form (dialog).

element.name: TCustomForm.Monitor
element.short: The Monitor on which the form is shown.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnActivate
element.short: Handler called when the form receives focus.

descr.p: This handler is called when the form receives focus for the first time at application start up and then subsequently each time focus is changed from another window of the same application to this window.
For focus changes between different applications the Application.OnActivate handler is called instead.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnClose
element.short: Handler called when the form is closed. It determines what happens to the form (destroy, hide...).

element.name: TCustomForm.OnCloseQuery
element.short: Handler called before the form is closed. It can reject an close request.
element.descr: An OnCloseQuery handler can check for unsaved information, ask the user whether it's okay to save or discard changes, or simply reject the close request.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnCreate
element.short: Handler called when the form has been created.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnDeactivate
element.short: Handler called when the form is deactivated (lost focus).

element.name: TCustomForm.OnDestroy
element.short: Handler called when the form is destroyed.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnDropFiles
element.short: Handler called when files have been dropped.
element.descr: You enable this feature by setting AllowDropFiles property.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnHelp
element.short: Handler called when Help is requested.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnHide
element.short: Handler called when the form is being hidden.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnShortcut
element.short: Handler called when a key is pressed, before further handling of the key.
element.descr: The handler can interpret the key as an shortcut and act accordingly.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnShow
element.short: Handler called when the form becomes visible.

element.name: TCustomForm.OnWindowStateChange
element.short: Handler called when the form is minimized, maximized or restored.

element.name: TCustomForm.PixelsPerInch
element.short: The logical scaling of the form [font? used where?]

element.name: TCustomForm.PopupMode
element.short: Where popup menus are shown[???]

element.name: TCustomForm.Position
element.short: The initial placement of the form.
element.descr: By default it is in the position that it was placed in the Form Designer

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredHeight
element.short: The height of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised).

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredLeft
element.short: The position of the left edge of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised).

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredTop
element.short: The position of the top edge of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised).

element.name: TCustomForm.RestoredWidth
element.short: The width of the form when it is restored (ie changes from minimised or maximised).

element.name: TCustomForm.ShowInTaskBar
element.short: How the form is represented in the system Task Bar.

element.name: TCustomForm.WindowState
element.short: Whether the form is currently minimized, maximized or normal (restored).
element.descr: Default is 'normal' (ie not minimized nor maximized)

element.name: TForm.Cascade
element.short: Arranges MDI child forms so they overlap.

element.name: TForm.Next
element.short: Activates the next child MDI form (fsMDIChild) in the form sequence.

element.name: TForm.Previous
element.short: Activates the previous MDI child form in the form sequence.

element.name: TForm.Tile
element.short: Arranges MDI child forms side by side.

element.name: TForm.LCLVersion
element.short: The version of the LCL as string. Used to distinguish form streams of different versions.

element.name: TFormClass
element.short: Class of TForm

element.name: TCustomDockForm
element.short: A floating DockSite, usable to make TControls float.

element.short: Makes the client occupy the entire client area (alClient).

element.name: TCustomDockForm.DoRemoveDockClient
element.short: Closes (releases) the form after the last client has been undocked.

element.name: TCustomDockForm.GetSiteInfo
element.short: Disallows docking of an second client.

element.name: TCustomDockForm.Loaded
element.short: Tries to make all child controls dockclients. This is of little use in practice, a floating hostdocksite should have no child controls.

element.name: THintWindow
element.short: The popup box containing helpful information that appears when the mouse pointer hovers over an object.

descr.p: Usage:

element.name: THintWindow.FActivating
element.short: True during ActivateHint.

element.name: THintWindow.FAutoHideTimer
element.short: The timer used to make the hint disappear.

element.name: THintWindow.GetDrawTextFlags
element.short: Collect the flags for the formatting of the text.

element.name: THintWindow.AutoHideHint
element.short: Called when the hint timer expires. Hides the window.

element.name: THintWindow.WMNCHitTest
element.short: Treats the whole window as transparent.

element.name: THintWindow.ActivateHint
element.short: Shows the hint.

element.name: THintWindow.ActivateHintData
element.short: Extended version of ActivateHint. Override this method to make use of the additional data.

element.name: THintWindow.CalcHintRect
element.short: Determines the rectangle required for the hint display, based on the maximum text/window width.

element.name: THintWindow.CalcHintRect.MaxWidth
element.short: Greater zero, else the full monitor width is used.

element.name: THintWindow.Alignment
element.short: The intended text alignment.
element.descr: See DrawText [link?]

element.name: THintWindow.AutoHide
element.short: Does the hint disappear (get hidden) after a while?
element.descr: If AutoHide is TRUE, the hint disappears afer an interval specified by HideInterval.

element.name: THintWindow.HideInterval
element.short: The time after which the displayed hint disappears.

element.name: THintWindowClass
element.short: Class of THintWindow.

element.name: TScreen
element.short: Provides information about the display and related objects.

descr.p: The virtual screen (desktop) can include multiple physical Monitors.
Screen objects are Cursors, Fonts and Forms. For Delphi compatibility also (invisible) DataModules are listed.[?]
The currently active Form, Control and Cursor also are tracked.

element.name: TScreen.FLastActiveControl
element.short: The last active control, used to detect focus changes.

element.short: Clears the Monitors list.

element.name: TScreen.GetCursors.AIndex
element.short: The logical cursor ID.

element.short: The notification handler.

element.name: TScreen.DisableForms
element.short: Disable all forms except SkipForm.

descr.p: Used to show modal forms or dialogs.
The enabled state is determined from the widget, not from LCL properties.
If DisabledList is Nil, a new list is created. Then all disabled forms are added to that list.
When the modal form returns, call EnableForms to restore all forms.

element.short: The list containing all disabled forms.

element.name: TScreen.DisableForms.SkipForm
element.short: Don't disable this form (ignored if Nil).

element.name: TScreen.EnableForms.AFormList

element.short: The first queued method.

element.name: TAsyncCallQueue.Last
element.short: The last queued method.

element.name: TAsyncCallQueues
element.short: Management information for asynchronous callbacks.

descr.p: Two queues are used:
New calls are added to the Next queue.
When the application starts processing the calls, the Next queue becomes the Cur queue, and a new Next queue is created. This simplifies thread-safe addition of further calls.

element.name: TAsyncCallQueues.CritSec
element.short: The critical section for adding and removing queue elements.

element.name: TAsyncCallQueues.Cur
element.short: The currently processed queue. Processed entries are removed.

element.name: TAsyncCallQueues.Next
element.short: New calls are added to this queue.

descr.p: sbgAlways - show glyphs always (inspite of system preferences)
sbgNever - show glyphs never (inspite of system preferences)
sbgSystem - use system preferences for glyphs showing

element.name: TApplication
element.short: Application management and configuration for a GUI application.

descr.p: Provides a message loop, hooks for application event handlers, and more.
Includes the useful function MessageBox, a simple dialog intended for displaying error messages, but also usable as an alternative to the various Message Dialogs.
Other project types have a different [or no?] Application class[?]

element.name: TApplication.HandleException
element.short: HandleException method for handling an exception; attempts to maintain program execution if possible, otherwise exits gracefully
element.descr:
Individual exception handler methods should be supplied by the application programmer, to override place-holder entries declared in ancestor classes.
This method checks whether the application is required to halt if an exception occurs, or invokes the appropriate handler.
It also writes details of the exception to the appropriate place for debugging.

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox
element.short: Display an message dialog with several response buttons.

descr.p: The function is used internally to display messages during the handling of Exceptions, but is also available to application programmers as an alternative to some of the message dialogs found in Dialogs.
The function returns an integer value corresponding to the button that was pressed; its value can be determined by reference to the constants [IDOK..IDHELP].

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Result
element.short: Indicates the pressed button.
element.descr:
Can be one of the following values:
IDOK
IDCANCEL
IDABORT
IDRETRY
IDIGNORE
IDYES
IDNO
IDCLOSE
IDHELP

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Text
element.short: The text in the MessageBox.

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Caption
element.short: The Caption of the MessageBox.

element.name: TApplication.MessageBox.Flags
element.short: The icon and buttons appearing in the box.

descr.p: Several constants are declared in the LCLType unit.

Add (better: OR) an icon constant and a buttons constant, for example
MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE + MR_ICONQUESTION will cause the application to display a query (?) icon in a box with three buttons:
ABORT RETRY IGNORE.
Buttons can be one of:

MB_OK
MB_OKCANCEL
MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE
MB_YESNOCANCEL
MB_YESNO
MB_RETRYCANCEL
The icon can be one of:

MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONQUESTION
MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
MB_ICONASTERISK
MB_ICONWARNING = MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
MB_ICONERROR = MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONSTOP = MB_ICONHAND
MB_ICONINFORMATION = MB_ICONASTERISK

descr.p: The type of the application:
Default, Desktop, Handheld, PDA, Smartphone

element.short: The bidirectional mode to use.

element.short: Enables searching for global components by name.[?]

element.name: TApplication.Flags
element.short: Application state flags.

element.name: TApplication.Hint
element.short: The current Hint text.

descr.p: A hint is a small pop-up mesage that appears briefly while the mouse hovers over a control.
It usually displays useful information about how to use an object or what data should be entered, etc
Several properties allow to customize the delay before a Hint is shown, after an mouse move, and how long it will stay visible.

element.name: TApplication.HintColor
element.short: The color of Hint windows.

element.name: TApplication.HintHidePause
element.short: How long a Hint stays visible, after an mouse move.

element.name: TApplication.HintHidePausePerChar
element.short: How much a keystroke extends the time a Hint stays visible (added to HintHidePause).

element.name: TApplication.HintPause
element.short: The delay before a Hint is shown.

element.name: TApplication.HintShortCuts
element.short: Enables the display of keyboard shortcuts (e.g. on menu entries). [not implemented?]

element.name: TApplication.HintShortPause
element.short: The pause before a different Hint is displayed.

element.name: TApplication.Icon
element.short: The icon associated with this application.

element.name: TApplication.MainForm
element.short: The application terminates when this form is closed.

element.name: TApplication.MainFormHandle
element.short: The Handle of the MainForm[?]

element.name: TApplication.ModalLevel
element.short: The number of modal forms shown.
element.descr: Tracks modal forms showing another form modally.

element.name: TApplication.MouseControl
element.short: The control currently under the mouse.
element.descr: Used to detect mouse entering and leaving a control.

element.name: TApplication.Navigation
element.short: Allows to switch between controls by pressing keys.

descr.p: These keys can be enabled for navigation:

ul.li: The Tab key moves the Focus to the next (or previous) control in TabOrder.
The Enter key triggers the default action.
The Escape key triggers the Cancel action.
The F1 key brings up context sensitive help.
The Arrow keys move the focus.[?]

element.descr: Some platforms show glyphs on all buttons, others don't.
